questions.question_text:
A company is seeking a new backup solution for its virtualized file servers that fits the following characteristics:
✑ The files stored on the servers are extremely large.
✑ Existing files receive multiple small changes per day.
✑ New files are only created once per month.
✑ All backups are being sent to a cloud repository.
Which of the following would BEST minimize backup size?

comments.content:
option D would minimize the backup size most, and they were not asking for a backup strategy, but select one of the options
Most modern backup solutions for virtual environments utilize a technology called Changed Block Tracking (CBT). CBT is an incremental backup technology for virtual machines that creates faster and smaller backups

No, Changed Block Tracking (CBT) is a feature that identifies blocks of data that have changed or in use.
-> It enables incremental backups. It is not a backup strategy.
Right, there's too many changes being made for it to be differential. With multiple changes being made per day, and with the files being large in size, a differential backup would grow too large.

discussion.content: Right answer is D incremental backups -change block tracking - is the right answer.

Going with B. 

They only care about backup size and differential backup will do the job better than a full or local/replicated backup. It also provides a better level of redundancy. Kinda odd they didn't have incremental as an answer, probably to confuse you.

https://phoenixnap.com/kb/full-vs-incremental-vs-differential-backup

questions.question_text: The CSA needs to install a patch on 58 virtual server instances during the Friday evening maintenance window. Which of the following is the MOST efficient way to get the patches installed?

discussion.content: Correct, it's literally in the name.

choices.B: Use a security vulnerability scanning tool to apply the patch automatically.
choices.A: Use the patch management tool to automate and orchestrate the patch installation.
choices.D: Connect the server instances to the Internet to download the patch automatically.
choices.C: Schedule the patch to install from a remote file server upon server reboot.

choices.A: Change the server template size for Inxpc003 to 2x-large.
choices.D: Change the role of Inxw001 from web to application.
choices.C: Add memory to Inxpc002, Inxpc003, and Inxpc003.
choices.B: Provision additional Inxpc servers using the 2x-large template.

discussion.content: It should be B since the key here is "Given an expected increase in workload" which means the load will increase even more than current results

I'd say it's B. It only talks about pre-defined templates so I don't think vertical scaling would be an option. Change one of the servers wouldn't make much difference as well as the other 2 already are 2x-large and are having problems as well.
I think it must scale vertically. => A

questions.question_text: A company wants to leverage a SaaS provider for its back-office services, and security is paramount. Which of the following solutions should a cloud engineer deploy to BEST meet the security requirements?

discussion.content:
D. CASB

covers more than one part of security.
D. A Cloud access security broker, or CASB, is cloud-hosted software or on-premises software or hardware that act as an intermediary between users and cloud service providers.

questions.question_text: A company upgraded a hosted vulnerability scanner to the latest version, and now tickets are not being created to assign critical vulnerabilities. After confirming the ticketing issue, all the scanning services are confirmed to be running on the VM. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause and best method to fix the issue?

choices.B: The upgrade has a bug Reboot the server and attempt the upgrade again.
choices.C: The vulnerability scanner is on a different subnet. Open the ports, and it will reconnect.
choices.D: There is an application compatibility issue. Roll back to the previous working backup.
choices.A: There was an IP change to the VM. Make changes to the server properties.

discussion.content:
There's no mention of moving the scanner. only answer that makes sense is 

D.
D. There is an application compatibility issue. Roll back to the previous working backup.
